We convince ourselves that life will be better after we get married, have a baby, then another. Then we're dissatisfied that the kids aren't old enough and we'll be more  _  when
they are. After that, we're frustrated that we have  _  teenagers
to deal with. We'll certainly be happy when we are out of that  _  .
   We tell ourselves that our life will be  _  when we get a nice car, are able to go
on a nice vacation and when we retire.
   But the   _  is:
there is no better time to be happy than right now. Your life will always be
filled with challenges. It's best to  _  this and decide
to be happy anyway.
   One my  _  quotes   comes from Alfred D. Souza, who said, "For a long time it had seemed to me life was about to begin---real life. But there was always some  _  in the way."
This viewpoint has helped me to see that there is no  _  to
happiness. Happiness is the way itself. So,  _  every
moment that you have now and share it with your loved ones... and  _  that time waits for no one.
   So,   _  waiting until you finish school, until you go to university, until you
start work, until you find a boy or girl friend, until you get married, until
you get a new car or home, until you have kids, until your kids leave the
house, until you get  _    ,until you get remarried,
until you retire, until spring, until summer,... until you die, until you are
born again to decide that to be happy you have no  _  time
than right now.
   Happiness is a journey, not a(n)   _  .(292)
